00043 
00044 const char* MsqError::error_message() const
00045 {
00046   static const char* const error_messages[] = {
00047    "No Error",
00048    "<unknown>",
00049    "Out of memory",
00050    "Invalid argument",
00051    "Data not initialized",
00052    "Invalid state",
00053    "File access error",
00054    "File format error",
00055    "Syntax error",
00056    "I/O error",
00057    "Invalid mesh",
00058    "No storage mode for PatchData",
00059    "Not implemented",
00060    "Internal error",
00061    "Interrupted",
00062    "Duplicate tag name",
00063    "Tag not found",
00064    "Unsupported element type",
00065    "Parallel Error - error occurred on at least one processor",
00066    "barruer violated when processing barrier Target Metric",
00067    "Invalid Error Code"
00068   };
00069   
00070     /* If this is ever false, it should be caught by a unit test. 
00071        Do an assert here so the unit test fails.
00072        This asserts that all error codes have a string in the above list. */
00073   assert( sizeof(error_messages) == sizeof(char*) * (LAST_ERROR_CODE+1) );
00074   
00075   if (!errorMessage.empty())
00076     return errorMessage.c_str();
00077   
00078   if (errorCode >= 0 && errorCode < LAST_ERROR_CODE)
00079     return error_messages[errorCode];
00080   
00081   return error_messages[LAST_ERROR_CODE];
00082 }
00083 
00084 MsqError::~MsqError() {}

00086 bool MsqError::Setter::set( const std::string& msg, ErrorCode num )
00087 {
00088   return mErr.set_error( num, msg.c_str() ) 
00089       && mErr.push( functionName, fileName, lineNumber );
00090 }
00091 
00092 bool MsqError::Setter::set( const char* msg, ErrorCode num )
00093 {
00094   return mErr.set_error( num, msg )
00095       && mErr.push( functionName, fileName, lineNumber );
00096 }
00097 
00098 bool MsqError::Setter::set( ErrorCode num )
00099 {
00100   return mErr.set_error( num )
00101       && mErr.push( functionName, fileName, lineNumber );
00102 }
00103 
00104 bool MsqError::Setter::set( ErrorCode num, const char* format, ... )
00105 {
00106   char buffer[1024];
00107   
00108 #if defined(HAVE_VSNPRINTF)
00109   va_list args;
00110   va_start( args, format );
00111   vsnprintf( buffer, sizeof(buffer), format, args );
00112   va_end( args );
00113 #elif defined(HAVE__VSNPRINTF)
00114   va_list args;
00115   va_start( args, format );
00116   _vsnprintf( buffer, sizeof(buffer), format, args );
00117   va_end( args );
00118 #elif defined(HAVE_VSPRINTF)
00119   va_list args;
00120   va_start( args, format );
00121   vsprintf( buffer, format, args );
00122   va_end( args );
00123 #else
00124   strncpy( buffer, format, sizeof(buffer) );
00125   buffer[sizeof(buffer)-1] = '\0';
00126 #endif
00127 
00128   return mErr.set_error( num, buffer )
00129       && mErr.push( functionName, fileName, lineNumber );
00130 }
00131 
00132 bool MsqError::push( const char* function, const char* file, int line )
00133 {
00134   stackTrace.push_back( Trace(function, file, line) );
00135   return true;
00136 }
00137 
00138 bool MsqError::set_error( ErrorCode num, const char* msg )
00139 {
00140   errorCode = num;
00141   stackTrace.clear();
00142   
00143   if (msg)
00144     errorMessage = msg;
00145   else
00146           // MS VC6 doesn't have string::clear()!
00147         errorMessage.resize(0);
00148     
00149   return num != NO_ERROR;
00150 }
00151 
00152 void MsqError::clear()
00153 {
00154   errorCode = NO_ERROR;
00155         // MS VC6 doesn't have string::clear()!
00156   errorMessage.resize(0);
00157   stackTrace.clear();
00158 }
00159 
00160 std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& str, const MsqError::Trace& tr ) 
00161 {
00162   return (str << tr.function << " at " << tr.file << ":" << tr.line);
00163 }
00164 
00165 std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& str, const MsqError& err ) 
00166 {
00167   str << "MESQUITE ERROR " << (int)err.error_code() << " : " 
00168       << err.error_message() << std::endl;
00169 
00170   MsqError::StackTrace::const_iterator iter = err.stack().begin();
00171   const MsqError::StackTrace::const_iterator end = err.stack().end();
00172   if (iter != end)
00173   {
00174     str << "  at " << *iter << std::endl;
00175     ++iter;
00176   }
00177   for ( ; iter != end; ++iter)
00178     str << "  in " << *iter << std::endl;
00179   
00180   return str;
00181 }

00183 MsqPrintError::~MsqPrintError()
00184   { if (error()) outputStream << *this << std::endl; }
